title: Heavy Snow Blankets Southern Wisconsin, Northern Illinois | Video | abc12.com
text: Heavy Snow Blankets Southern Wisconsin, Northern Illinois - - Updated [0](https://www.abc12.com/video/heavy-snow-blankets-southern-wisconsin-northern-illinois/video_77c1337d-e30c-5489-8e27-8bedd7eeb33e.html#comments) Weather Alert ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR SNOW-COVERED ROADWAYS AND REDUCED VISIBILITIES THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... WEATHER... * Light to moderate snow will continue to impact the region this afternoon, north of M59. Snow is then expected to fill back in south of the M59 corridor late tonight. * New snow accumulations up to an inch through the late afternoon. * Southeast to east winds around 10 mph. * Air temperatures will range between 28 and 31 degrees. IMPACTS... * Accumulating snow will lead to slippery or snow covered roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. * Light to moderate snow will cause reductions of visibility to less than one mile. There may be rapid fluctuations of visibility. IMPACTS... * Accumulating snow will lead to slippery or snow covered roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. * Light to moderate snow will cause reductions of visibility to less than one mile. There may be rapid fluctuations of visibility. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...; * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Shiawassee, Genesee, Lapeer, St. Clair, Livingston, Oakland and Macomb Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow banding will be possible this afternoon and evening, capable of producing snow rates up to a half inch per hour within a 1-3 hour window. Peak snowfall window for the I-69 corridor will be between 4 pm and 10 pm and for the M-59 corridor between 7 pm and midnight tonight. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and use caution while traveling. && Currently in Flint 31°F Snow 31°F / 24°F 4 PM 31°F 5 PM 32°F 6 PM 31°F 7 PM 33°F 8 PM 31°F Online Poll [ FanZone Championship: Kearsley v. Genesee](/fanzone-championship-kearsley-v-genesee/poll_457ee72e-ddda-11ee-b23a-57d15f882658.html) You voted: © Copyright 2024 [Allen Media Broadcasting](https://allenmediabroadcasting.com/), 2302 Lapeer Road Flint, MI | [Terms of Use](/site/terms.html)| [Privacy Policy](/site/privacy.html) Powered by
